timeline.bodyText:
I think we should check if the connector exists before attempting to call the client.create, and only if ifNotExists is true. I noticed the client.create() code retries up to 3 times in the following cases:
.retryIfResult(
              result -> result == null
                  || result.httpCode() >= HttpStatus.SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
                  || result.httpCode() == HttpStatus.SC_CONFLICT)

There's no need to retry if the connector exists, right? Better just check if it exists to keep this command faster, then return the WarningEntity, otherwise try the create.
timeline.author: spena

replies.bodyText:
@big-andy-coates  above had suggested inconsistencies might creep in

Of course, this would suffer from a race condition: the connector could be added by another system between the connectorExists check and the addConnector call. So really, we also need the addConnector call to gracefully handle the already exists

Would it rather be better to remove result.httpCode() == HttpStatus.SC_CONFLICT) from retryIfResult() since we will be handling HttpStatus.SC_CONFLICT with a WarningEntity ,
Meaning does it make sense to even retry when we know the connector exists
replies.author: hemantgs

replies.bodyText:
Sadly we can't. The SC_CONFLICT may also happen if the worker group is in a rebalancing process.
POST /connectors
Create a new connector, returning the current connector info if successful. Return 409 (Conflict) if rebalance is in process

What do you think of adding the check before attempting to create the connector just to avoid the retries, and also leave the current check you have in this PR in case a race-condition happens? As mentioned by Andy we also need the addConnector call to gracefully handle the already exists
replies.author: spena

replies.bodyText:
SC_CONFLICT may also happen if the worker group is in a rebalancing process.

Ah ! I did not know that ,
so yeah I feel that would be the better option .
I have updated the PR ..
Lots of conditionals to handle all cases 😄
